reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Scaling up quality HIV case cascade through community engagement and addressing human rights barriers

description.narrative: Ghana - HIV - West African Program to Combat AIDS and STI - WAPCAS. This program has the following goals: To reduce new HIV infections and AIDS-related deaths through the delivery of a comprehensive package of care to PLHIV including pregnant women and KPs.. To reduce by 20% the 2013 TB prevalence baseline level of 264 per 100,000 population by 2020 in line with post 2015 Global TB control strategy. To reduce by 35% the 2012 TB mortality rate baseline of 4 deaths per 100,000 population by 2020 in line with post 2015 Global TB control strategy. To end the TB epidemic in Ghana by 2035 without catastrophic cost due to TB affected families. The objectives of this program are: Increase the estimated PLHIV who know their status annually from 40% in 2016 to 90% by 2020.. Increase PMTCT-ARV coverage from 36% in 2016 to 82% in 2020. Increase ART initiation among HIV-positive KP from 29% among MSM and 35% among FSW in 2016 to 82% in both groups in selected districts in 2020. Increase the percentage of HIV-positive TB patients on ART from 40% in 2016 to 77% in 2020. Increase the proportion of clients on ART who are virally suppressed from the projected baseline of 85% of PLHIV on ART in 2017 to 90% by 2020.. To early screen, detect and enrol into treatment all forms of notified (new cases) from 15,606 in 2013 to 37,302 by 2020, while increasing the proportion of bacteriologically confirmed pulmonary TB from 49% in 2013 to 60% by 2020. To early detect and enrol into treatment at least 85% of confirmed MDR-TB cases among new and previously treated cases by 2020.. To attain higher treatment success for all forms of TB from 84% in 2012 to at least 91% by 2020 through improved quality clinical care and community TB care. To reduce death rates of TB/HIV co-infected cases from 20% in 2012 to 10% by 2020 and uptake of ART coverage among co-infected from 37% in 2013% to 90% by 2020. To improve Programme management; coordination Monitoring & Evaluation and operations research to support treatment and screening strategies for TB/HIV

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for GHA-H-WAPCAS
TCS-Other 1: Percentage of newly diagnosed Sex Workers linked to HIV care (individual linkage)
CRS-other 1: Percentage of TB cases identified through CSOs (CSS) activities
Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of people newly diagnosed with HIV initiated on ART
Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of men who have sex with men that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Impact indicator for GHA-H-WAPCAS
Percentage of men who have sex with men who are living with HIV
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
Estimated percentage of children newly infected with HIV from mother-to-child transmission among women living with HIV delivering in the past 12 months
Outcome indicator for GHA-H-WAPCAS
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a non regular partner
Percentage of sex workers who avoid health care because of stigma and discrimination
Percentage of sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a male partner
Percentage of adults and children with HIV, known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART who are virologically suppressed
Percentage of men who have sex with men who avoid health care because of stigma and discrimination
